metadata.synopsis: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)

5.speaker: Mattis
5.text: I don't talk to dead scabs, scab. Keep moving.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm sorry for taking your ring. Here you go.

21.speaker: Mattis
21.text: Huh. Don't think anyone's ever apologised for stealing my stuff before.

270.speaker: Mattis
270.text: You know what? We're square. I'll tell the others to leave you alone too.

319.speaker: Mattis
319.text: Don't worry about it. Now, you wanna buy something this time?

322.speaker: Mattis
322.text: Well, grudges don't buy bread, and I gotta eat. Speaking of which, wanna trade?

67.speaker: Player
67.text: While I'm here, could we trade?

65.speaker: Mattis
65.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

290.speaker: Mattis
290.text: Yeah, I know. I was standing right here, telling her to rob you.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I want an apology from her.

320.speaker: Mattis
320.text: Want all you want. She's somewhere safe and staying that way.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: You could at least pretend to be sorry.

147.speaker: Mattis
147.text: I am sorry! Sorry we're still talking about this.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sincere, then mocking. NodeContext: Insistent, then mocking.

39.speaker: Mattis
39.text: Look, you caught her. Good for you, you aren't a chump like everybody else around here.

345.speaker: Mattis
345.text: Now, do me a favour. Make room for the chumps.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: You can make it right - by giving me a percentage of your take.

163.speaker: Mattis
163.text: Fine. I'm not so good at counting, but I think any percentage of zero is zero.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: If you touch my pack again, I'll pull your horns off. Slowly.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunkers down to speak to her

344.speaker: Mattis
344.text: I get it, you're not a chump, but we're just trying to survive.

52.speaker: Mattis
52.text: So move along, okay? Make room for the real chumps.

351.speaker: Player
351.text: Careful. Not everyone is as forgiving as I am.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I should remove one of your sister's fingers - as a lesson.

215.speaker: Mattis
215.text: No! I mean - it's nothing personal, lady.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Thieves make poor slaves - until you break them, at least.

333.speaker: Mattis
333.text: Hey! You're not taking any slaves here.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Have you no honour, hell child?

303.speaker: Mattis
303.text: Yeah, well, you can't eat honour.

338.speaker: Player
338.text: Watch it. Where I'm from thieves are punished - harshly.

323.speaker: Mattis
323.text: Oh yeah? Are they bored to death?

84.speaker: Mattis
84.text: Hey, you're back! Look to buy, sell, or what?

251.speaker: Player
251.text: I don't have your ring. It vanished.

114.speaker: Mattis
114.text: That a fact? Well, they're magical rings. Maybe it vanished, y'know, magic'ly.

88.speaker: Mattis
88.text: Good news is, I got more on sale. Interested?

337.speaker: Player
337.text: That's not how magic rings work.

32.speaker: Mattis
32.text: Maybe it's how this one worked?

102.speaker: Mattis
102.text: Look, do you want to buy something or nothing?

229.speaker: Mattis
229.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Smiling, the girl opened her pack.*

219.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Opening her pack, the girl makes a strange gesture with her free hand.* (to her partner)

35.speaker: Mattis
35.text: Well, what you think? Good stuff, right?

331.speaker: Mattis
331.text: Sorry to hear that. Keep checking back!

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Could be worth something if I had a furnace to melt it down.

70.speaker: Mattis
70.text: Well, thanks for the honesty, I guess.

234.speaker: Narrator
234.text: *You were robbed. And by the feel of your pack, not for the first time.*

308.speaker: Narrator
308.text: *As you turn to leave, you realise the other child does too. She looked nervous.*

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *You spot the boy giving a sly wink as he turns away.*

148.speaker: Mattis
148.text: Hold out your hand. Let me show you something.

316.speaker: Mattis
316.text: I heard stories about you. How you all live underground and steal kids away.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Yes. Surface dwellers tell all sorts of lies about us.

56.speaker: Mattis
56.text: Us too! No one says anything nice about tieflings.

305.speaker: Mattis
305.text: Here, want to see a trick?

74.speaker: Mattis
74.text: I dunno. You don't look that scary.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Nonsense! We kill far more children than we enslave.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You're thinking of the Lolth-sworn. Should you see a pair of red eyes? Run.

284.speaker: Mattis
284.text: ...Um, hey, would you like to see something fun?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I'm half-drow - I only steal half the children I meet.

350.speaker: Mattis
350.context: NodeContext: Nervous, then realises it's a joke.

209.speaker: Mattis
209.text: You some kind of elf or something?

307.speaker: Mattis
307.text: Huh. Never heard of those. Guess I have now!

313.speaker: Player
313.text: What makes you think I'm an elf?

22.speaker: Mattis
22.text: They look nice. You look nice. It was just a guess.

134.speaker: Mattis
134.text: Anyway, to business. Hold out your hand. I want to show you something.

27.speaker: Mattis
27.text: Uh... blood and rust. Someone stole the damn ring!
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Patting own pockets, small smile. NodeContext: Amused

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I might have had something to do with that.

100.speaker: Mattis
100.text: You? You skimmed me? I was trying to skim you! Ahahaha!
100.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving, ending in deep, genuine laugh.

132.speaker: Mattis
132.text: Keep the ring. No hard feelings. That was some sharp work, mate.

156.speaker: Mattis
156.text: But word to the wise? You should probably let my boss know you're working here.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning inNodeContext: One thief to another.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: You have a boss? Maybe I'll pay a visit.

61.speaker: Mattis
61.text: Good. Mol's office is through the crack in the wall over there.

187.speaker: Mattis
187.text: Your funeral. Mol gets spicy when people leave her out of the know.

296.speaker: Mattis
296.text: If you change your mind, she's through that crack in the wall over there. And one more thing?

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Is your boss part of the thieves' guild?

318.speaker: Mattis
318.text: I mean- I don't think so?

267.speaker: Mattis
267.text: Look, just talk to Mol. She's through that crack in the wall. She'll tell you what's what.

235.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic node: the kid produces a shiny gold ring out of nowhere with a flourish. It's a sleight-of-hand trick with no magical sparkles.|

217.speaker: Mattis
217.text: Go on. Take this ring. It's lucky.

314.speaker: Mattis
314.text: Uh. I never learned names or anything. Just the tricks.
314.context: CinematicNodeContext: UncertainNodeContext: Off-balance, unsure of herself

130.speaker: Mattis
130.text: Anyway, forget that. Take the ring! I wanna show you how lucky it is!
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Urging the player to take the ring she's holding.

112.speaker: Mattis
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: |She produces a coin and prepares to flip it.|

179.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: She flips a coin, catches it, and looks down at her hand.|

210.speaker: Mattis
210.text: See? That's the kinda luck you get from just one of my lucky rings!

329.speaker: Mattis
329.text: I've got more where that came from. Real cheap, too. Interested?

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Hold on. One coin toss doesn't prove anything.

315.speaker: Mattis
315.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to flip the coin.NodeContext: Businesslike

263.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: She flips a coin, catches it, and looks down at her hand.|

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Here. Take your ring back. I want to see your wares.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I am indeed. I've got a free ring.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Not yet. Flip the coin again.

101.speaker: Mattis
101.text: You're killing me here. You really are.

69.speaker: Mattis
69.text: Just take the ring, huh? Free sample.

273.speaker: Mattis
273.text: Now, you wanna take a look at the other stuff I got? Or maybe you just wanna go.
273.context: NodeContext: Emphasizing "go". Character is annoyed with player.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Let me see what you have.

244.speaker: Narrator
244.text: *The metal is coarse and riddled with imperfections.*

204.speaker: Mattis
204.text: It's just a ring. I know it's nothing special.

343.speaker: Mattis
343.text: Now please. Please. Buy something or go.

169.speaker: Mattis
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Teeth gritted. Ready to flip the coinNodeContext: Teeth gritted.

175.speaker: Mattis
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Almost losing temper. Ready to flip the coinNodeContext: Almost says Fuck.

55.speaker: Mattis
55.text: Oh, come on. Okay. Heads or tails?
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to flip the coinNodeContext: Trying and failing to hold her temper.

193.speaker: Mattis
193.text: Really? I mean... fine. Heads or tails?
193.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to flip the coin

198.speaker: Player
198.text: The 'runes' on this ring are gibberish.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Did you really think you could fool me?

192.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: She flips a coin, catches it, and looks down at her hand.

327.speaker: Player
327.text: No thanks. Could I see your other wares?

181.speaker: Mattis
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Smiling, the girl opened her pack.*

153.context: CinematicNodeContext: The girl makes an odd gesture with her free hand. (to her partner)

341.speaker: Mattis
341.text: You bought something. Most everybody says it looks like junk and moves on.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I just wanted to support a young businessman.

340.speaker: Mattis
340.text: Oh, you have. You definitely have.
340.context: NodeContext: Smirking - she just stole something from the player.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: Collecting junk is a hobby of mine.

34.speaker: Mattis
34.text: Really. Good thing we met, then!

208.speaker: Mattis
208.text: Anyway, see you again sometime. Take care! Safe travels!

299.speaker: Narrator
299.text: *You were robbed. And by the feel of your pack, not for the first time.*

207.speaker: Narrator
207.text: *As you turn to leave, you realise the other child does too. She looks nervous.*

168.speaker: Mattis
168.text: Not sure what you expected. I'm a kid living at the back of a cave.
168.context: NodeContext: Smirking - she just stole something from the player.

287.speaker: Narrator
287.text: *You spot the boy giving a sly wink as he turns away.*

12.speaker: Mattis
12.text: Hey, hold on. You gotta pay for that!

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Here. You can have it back. Now, what do you have for sale?

152.speaker: Player
152.text: You're getting paid in experience. The ring is mine now.

358.speaker: Mattis
358.text: Fine, keep it. Call it a sample, yeah?

190.speaker: Mattis
190.text: But you gotta at least look at the other rings, okay? I gotta eat.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I don't have to do anything. Goodbye.

257.speaker: Mattis
257.text: You'll be sorry about this, scab. Count on it.

166.speaker: Mattis
166.text: I, uh, I don't know what you mean.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Come on. This is a Tinker's Trash scam. A clumsy one.

227.speaker: Mattis
227.text: Hey, that hurts. I'm running an honest... okay, what's a Tinker's Trash?
227.context: NodeContext: Ends in interest. She's a con learning about a new con.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: It's when a scammer offers the target a 'magic' object...

49.speaker: Mattis
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Staring into space.NodeContext: Interested, listening.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: ... then rigs a game to gain the target's trust and sell them trash.

183.speaker: Mattis
183.text: And I promise this isn't a Tinker's Trash scam.
183.context: NodeContext: (It's a different kind of scam)

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Fine. Take the ring. I just want to trade.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives back the ring.

230.context: InternalNodeContext: Added for cinematics transition purposes.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Then what kind of con is it?
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives back the ring.

245.speaker: Mattis
245.text: Look, I swear to you. These rings are the real deal. I promise I'm not running a scam.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Actually, never mind. Just take your ring.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Take your ring. I don't have time for this.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Anyone could see this was a modified War Widow scam.

133.speaker: Mattis
133.text: The hell it is. You can't do that one with rings. It has to be bracelets because...
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing offNodeContext: Falters over the last word. She accidentally admitted she knows about con games.

260.speaker: Mattis
260.context: CinematicNodeContext: Revealed too much, a little embarrassed.

172.speaker: Mattis
172.text: Last chance. You want a look at my stuff or not?

104.speaker: Player
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives back the ring.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Just take your ring and count yourself lucky.
264.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives back the ring.

317.speaker: Mattis
317.text: No fooling you, is there? All right, get walking. Leave some room for the chumps, huh?
317.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sly look, no longer distraught.NodeContext: Chuckle, sly look.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: No - and I'm keeping the ring.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: Take your ring. I don't have time for this.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: If there was magic in this ring, I'd have felt it. It's nothing but junk.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: This is no magic ring. The runes are gibberish.

90.speaker: Mattis
90.text: You caught me, all right? They're not lucky rings.

83.speaker: Mattis
83.text: I'm just... trying to earn money for my family. My father left and my mother... she's so sick.

53.speaker: Mattis
53.text: I wish I had better things to sell than... trinkets, but it's all I have!
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fake sadness.NodeContext: On the edge of tears.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: All right, take your ring. What do you have to trade?

87.speaker: Mattis
87.text: Thank you. That... means so much.

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: She flips a coin, catches it, and looks down at her hand.|

13.speaker: Mattis
13.text: Hey, hold on. You gotta pay for that!

86.speaker: Player
86.text: It's only a joke. Go on - flip your coin.

109.speaker: Mattis
109.text: Real sweet sense of humour you got there, chum.

25.speaker: Mattis
25.text: Anyways, you gotta call before the flip. Heads or tails?

352.speaker: Player
352.text: Vanish the ring with a reverse Hammar's Flourish.

6.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: The PC makes the ring disappear like the kid made it appear. No sparkles, just sleight-of-hand.|

113.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: *My reflexes were a bit rusty, and I nearly dropped the ring. The girl winced.*|

99.speaker: Mattis
99.text: Hard luck. But like I said, we can change that. Watch!
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wince, watching a bad mad magic trick,

145.speaker: Mattis
145.text: Go on! Take the ring and watch your fortune change!

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Mimic his trick and make the ring disappear.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Spin the ring in an elaborate parlour trick.

2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard player spins the ring around the fingers of one hand, before closing their hand in a fist. they open the fist of their other hand, and the ring is there.

97.speaker: Mattis
97.text: Okay, maybe you don't need extra luck. But since you're already holding the thing...

40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard player spins the ring around the fingers of one hand, and drop it on the floor. Looking embarrassed, they pick it back up/

154.speaker: Mattis
154.text: Hey, you're back! Here to buy some stuff?

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Is there a larger entrance to the hideout?

348.speaker: Mattis
348.text: Dunno. I just use the one I know.

359.speaker: Mattis
359.text: Bet you can find another one, though. This place has tonnes of tunnels and stuff.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Have you taken something? Something that doesn't belong to you?

85.speaker: Mattis
85.text: Me? No, promise. I'm just a kid trying to make a living.

123.speaker: Mattis
123.text: You know who you should talk to? Mol. She's my... boss, I guess. Good at finding stuff.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: We've met. She told me to leave.

171.speaker: Mattis
171.text: I know, but you didn't have business with her then. Now you do. Good luck!

312.speaker: Player
312.text: We've met. She tried to kill me.

7.speaker: Mattis
7.text: She what? Blood and rust. What'd you do?

72.speaker: Mattis
72.text: You know what? Forget your junk. You got bigger problems if you pissed off Mol.

47.speaker: Mattis
47.text: Her office is through the crack in the wall over there, if you can fit.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: Then I'll get my answers out of her.

180.speaker: Mattis
180.context: NodeContext: Slightly smirking, pleased she's offloaded you to someone else.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: If you're lying to me, I'll rip those horns off your adorable little head.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: It would be a grave mistake, were you to lie to the great Gale of Waterdeep...

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Careful. Not everyone is as forgiving as I am.

174.speaker: Mattis
174.text: Look, whatever you think, take it up with Mol.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Find yourself another line of work. Second-rate pickpockets tend to lose their hands.

182.speaker: Mattis
182.text: I- look, I don't want trouble.

309.speaker: Mattis
309.text: Just talk to Mol, okay? She's the one you need.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: If you have lied to me, I will feed you to spiders. One piece at a time.

342.speaker: Player
342.text: Why should I trust a mere hatchling?

354.speaker: Mattis
354.text: If you have another choice, you go right ahead.

297.speaker: Player
297.text: Do I look like someone you want to steal from?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: A warning? Where I come from, thieves are punished - harshly.

128.speaker: Mattis
128.text: Yeah? Are they bored to death?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I've been playing this game longer than you. I tend to win.

48.speaker: Mattis
48.text: Yeah? Me too. And if you want your stuff back, you gotta talk to her.

332.speaker: Mattis
332.context: NodeContext: Dismisses you with a sneer

157.speaker: Mattis
157.text: Hey, you're back. Here to trade?

165.speaker: Mattis
165.text: Keep moving, huh? I'm working here.

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *You recognise his movements - Mol's hand signal.*
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: *She flashed the hand-signal Mol had taught me and turned away.*

236.speaker: Mattis
236.text: Think you could stand back a ways, pal? I'm fishing for chumps here.

241.speaker: Mattis
241.text: I still have no idea how you took my ring. Mol won't say it, but she's impressed.

288.speaker: Mattis
288.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

289.speaker: Mattis
289.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

199.speaker: Mattis
199.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

261.speaker: Mattis
261.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

223.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*She whistled softly, then nodded at me with new respect before turning away.*|

325.speaker: Mattis
325.text: Not sure what you did to piss off Mol. Don't want to know. Keep walking, scab.

349.speaker: Mattis
349.text: Hells, you get everywhere, don't you?
